intro: Cylindropuntia, commonly known as the cholla cactus, is a genus of flowering plants in the cactus family, Cactaceae. These plants are native to the Americas, particularly the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. They are characterized by their cylindrical or clavate stems, which are often covered in spines and sometimes flowers. Cylindropuntia species are adapted to arid environments, storing water in their thick, fleshy stems. They play an important role in desert ecosystems by providing food and shelter for various animals.
